alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 11 at 9:00AM PST until December 12 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow showers...heavy at times. Additional local snow accumulations of 3 to 9 inches over higher elevations of the Western Plumas mountains. Up to 1 foot of additional accumulations possible in the Sierra Nevada. Local accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible down to 3500 feet and locally 1 to 2 inches down to 2500 feet elevation. Winds gusts of 50 mph or more possible over higher terrain. * WHERE...West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada, including Interstate 80 and Highway 50 and Western Plumas County including Lassen Park. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Chain controls, travel delays, and road closures expected. Gusty winds and heavy snow could bring down tree branches. Near whiteout conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels 2500 to 3500 feet. The majority of the snow accumulation will be above 4000 feet.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
